text: Silver chloride is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is AgCl. It contains silver in its +1 oxidation state. It also contains chloride ions. ==Properties== It is a white crystalline solid. It does not dissolve in water. When it is exposed to light, it turns back into silver and chlorine. It dissolves in several solutions, such as ammonia. ==Preparation== It can be made by reacting a common chloride such as sodium chloride with silver nitrate. ==Uses== It is used in photographic film. It darkens when exposed to light, which makes a picture. It is also used in electrochemistry. It is used as a disinfectant in bandages. It is also used to make stained glass. It can be used when someone is poisoned with mercury. ==Safety== It can irritate skin. It can also stain the skin. It is a weak oxidizing agent. ==Related pages== *Silver bromide *Silver iodide Category:Silver compounds Category:Chloride salts
